citation.article-title: Vagococcus lutrae sp. nov., isolated from the common otter (Lutra lutra)

p.s: Description of Vagococcus lutrae sp. nov.
Vagococcus lutrae (luo'trae. M.L. fem. gen. n. lutrae of or pertaining to the common otter, Lutra lutra, the mammal from which the bacterium was isolated)
Cells are Gram-positive cocci occurring as single cells, in pairs or in short chains elongated in the direction of the chain.
Small, smooth colonies up to 0.2 mm in diameter are formed on blood agar at 37°C.
Acid is produced from cyclodextrin, glucose, maltose, methyl-β-D-glucopyranoside, D-ribose, sorbitol, sucrose and trehalose.
Acid was not produced from D-arabitol, L-arabinose, glycogen, mannitol, melibiose, melezitose, pullulan, D-raffinose, tagatose or D-xylose.

Acid phosphatase, N-acetylglucosaminidase, chymotrypsin, ester lipase C-8, α-galactosidase, α-glucosidase, β-glucosidase, glycyltryptophan arylamidase, leucine arylamidase, β-mannosidase and pyroglutamic acid arylamidase activity is detected.
No activity for alanine-phenylalanine- proline arylamidase, arginine dihydrolase, afucosidase, β-glucuronidase, α-mannosidase, lipase C-14, trypsin, urease or valine arylamidase is detected.
Activity of alkaline phosphatase, β-galactosidase and β-galacturonidase is either weak or negative.
Aesculin is hydrolysed, but hippurate and gelatin are not.
